result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Dietz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including all applicable surcharges including the DNA and VWS surcharges.
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

No contact with BMC 8/25/1999.
No contact with females under the age of 18 without prior authorization from the agent. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Will be eligible for expungment of 14CF394 if and only if he successfully completes the period of probation and its conditions.
Undertake counseling to the extent that is reasonably deemed necessary by the agent.
Undertake AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Christopher Dietz in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Christopher Dietz in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CM178, 14CM444, 14CF394
9:38 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CM178 - NO CONTEST
14CM444 Count 2 - NO CONTEST
14CF394 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of 14CM178, 14CM444 Count 2, 14CF394 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Dismissed and read in are the following: 14CM444 Count 1, 14CF394 Counts 2 & 3. 

Court advises defendant of his right to sentencing.  Questions defendant if he would like to proceed. 
Defendant would like to proceed. 

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
14CM444 Count 2 - 
Serve 30 days jail w/ 30 days credit. 
Pay costs. 

14CM178 & 14CF394 Count 1 -
Sentence withheld: 
Placed on probation for 2 years on each count, concurrently to each other:
No contact with BMC 8/25/1999.
No contact with females under the age of 18 without prior authorization from the agent. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Undertake AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Undetake counseling to the extent that is reasonably deemed necessary by the agent.
Pay costs including all applicable surcharge including DNA and VWS surcharges. 
Will be eligible for expungment of 14CF394 if and only if he successfully completes the period of probation and its conditions. 
Should he be revoked and sentenced for non-complaince, he is entitled to credit for 107 days.

State has complied with Victim Rights Notifications.
Plea hearing on March 11, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Christopher J Dietz in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Christopher J Dietz in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:47 p.m.  Court calls the case. 
Atty Renc makes arguments in support of her motion. 
Atty Cousins makes arguments in opposition of the motion. 

BY THE COURT:  For the reasons stated on the record, motion is denied.
for Modification of Bond
Pre-trial conference on January 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher J Dietz in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Christopher J Dietz in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Atty Renc

(sent to DOC Interface on 02/14/22 sp)

ADA Elizabeth Constable appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
Cases heard at this time are 14GF-321 and 14CM-178.

1:20 PM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

14CM-178:
Defendant is appearing on a warrant that was issued on Sept 29th. There was a non appearance for a pretrial conference.
Court questions Defendant on his failure to appear.
Defendant states he was originally in jail and then was released, found out by one of his friends.
Defendant states does not remember where he was on September 15th.
Atty Constable states she was present at the pretrial with Atty Renc and Atty Renc stated that her client was aware of the court date.
Defendant states he has not been in contact with his attorney, is currently homeless. 
Defendant states the last place he was living at was with Doug and Tonya Allen. 

October 20th at 9:30 in Branch 2 wil be the pretrial date.
Defendant is to let his attorney know that he was picked up and that a pretrial has been set.
Court will amend bond to a cash bond of $500 with same conditions along with day reporting 7 times per week

14GF-321:
ADA Constable states facts for anticipated charges of Second Degree Sexual Assault of a Child.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
Defendant is not currently working.
State requests a $5,000 cash bond  with conditions as stated.

Defendant states that bond should be $1,000 cash.
Defendant promises that if released, he will go to all court hearings.
Defendant has been going to day report. Last time Defendant went to day report was two days ago. Defendant reports every day.
Court questions Defendant for clarifications on day reporting.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  October 20, 2014  @ 09:30 am.  in Branch 2

$500 cash bond - comply with conditions set forth in other bonds, no contact with B.M.C. with DOB of 8/25/99 - day report 7 times per week

Comply with conditions set forth in other bonds  Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  * B.M.C. with a date of birth of 8/25/1999  Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *Seven Times Per Week*
